args.description: The arguments that are passed to the Docker container. See https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/run/#cmd-default-command-or-options
args.markdownDescription:
The arguments that are passed to the Docker container. See https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/run/#cmd-default-command-or-options.

To use environment variables within `args` wrap the environment variable you wish to use with `$()`, for example, `$(SAIL_COMMIT_SHA)`.

command.description: The command that is passed to the Docker container. See https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/run/#cmd-default-command-or-options
command.markdownDescription:
The command that is passed to the Docker container. See https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/run/#cmd-default-command-or-options.

To use environment variables within `command` wrap the environment variable you wish to use with `$()`, for example, `$(SAIL_COMMIT_SHA)`.

env.description: The environment variables passed to the Docker container. See https://sail.ci/docs/environment-variables
env.markdownDescription:
The environment variables passed to the Docker container. See https://sail.ci/docs/environment-variables

For example:
```yaml
env:
  - MY_ENV_VAR
  - CUSTOM_ENV_VAR: "true"
  - REMAPPED_MY_ENV_VAR: $(MY_ENV_VAR)
  - REMAPPED_SAIL_COMMIT_SHA_VAR: $(SAIL_COMMIT_SHA)
```

image.description: Specifies what Docker image to use for the task.

mounts.description: The file mounts passed to the Docker container. See https://sail.ci/docs/mounts
mounts.markdownDescription:
The file mounts passed to the Docker container. See https://sail.ci/docs/mounts

For example:
```yaml
mounts:
  - /secret/my-filename.json: ENV_VAR_KEY
```

when.description: The conditionals to run against the task. See https://sail.ci/docs/conditional-tasks
when.markdownDescription:
The conditionals to run against the task. See https://sail.ci/docs/conditional-tasks

For example:
```yaml
when:
  ref: /heads/master$
  paths:
    - "packages/package-2/**/*"
```

tasks.description: The tasks that make up your pipeline.
